workflowInfo.workflowDescription: Provision stand alone WASt app server.

variable.name: SERVER_ID_NUM
variable.label: Server ID Number
variable.abstract: Three digit number identifying server instance (including leading zeroes)
variable.description: Three digit number identifying the server instance to be provisioned. This number is embedded in the server job name. For example, to provision server xx001, specify 001 for the Server ID Number.

variable.name: CONFIG_ROOT
variable.label: CONFIG_ROOT
variable.description: Each app server profile will be created in its own file system. This directory will contain mount points for each of those file systems.

variable.name: USER_HLQ
variable.label: USER_HLQ
variable.abstract: High level qualifier to be used for ZFS datasets
variable.description: A ZFS will be created to contain the profile for each provisioned app server. The ZFS dataset name will begin with this high level qualifier.

variable.name: SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX
variable.label: SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX
variable.abstract: Two character prefix for all servers in group
variable.description: Two character prefix for all servers in group. This is used to create user names, group names, proc names, and paths.

variable.name: CERT_AUTH_LABEL
variable.label: CERT_AUTH_LABEL
variable.description: Label of the Certificate authority to be created.

variable.name: CLOUD_NAME
variable.label: CLOUD_NAME
variable.description: The name of the cloud definition in the z/OS Communication Server

variable.name: DOMAIN_NAME
variable.label: DOMAIN_NAME
variable.abstract: Domain name to be used for provisioned app servers
variable.description: The zDaemonIPName parameter within zpmt.sh is set to a fully qualified host name formed by concatenating the SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX, the SERVER_ID_NUM, and this domain name.

variable.name: EXEC_DATASET
variable.label: EXEC_DATASET
variable.abstract: Dataset containing execs required for provisioning
variable.description: Dataset containing execs required for provisioning

variable.name: HOSTNAME
variable.label: HOSTNAME
variable.abstract: Host name of system where zosmf is running.
variable.description: Host name of system where zosmf is running.

variable.name: JOB_STATEMENT_1
variable.label: JOB_STATEMENT_1
variable.description: First job statement provided to zpmt.sh during profile creation. This is for future use.

variable.name: JOB_STATEMENT_2
variable.label: JOB_STATEMENT_2
variable.description: Second job statement provided to zpmt.sh during profile creation. This is for future use.

variable.name: JOB_STATEMENT_3
variable.label: JOB_STATEMENT_3
variable.description: Third job statement provided to zpmt.sh during profile creation. This is for future use.

variable.name: JOB_STATEMENT_4
variable.label: JOB_STATEMENT_4
variable.description: Fourth job statement provided to zpmt.sh during profile creation. This is for future use.

variable.name: PROCLIB
variable.label: PROCLIB
variable.description: Name of dataset within JES PROCLIB concatenation that will contain procs used by the app server.

variable.name: SYSPLEX_NAME
variable.label: SYSPLEX_NAME
variable.description: Name of the sysplex where zosmf is running

variable.name: SYSTEM_NAME
variable.label: SYSTEM_NAME
variable.description: Name of the system where zosmf is running

variable.name: WAS_PATH
variable.label: WAS_PATH
variable.description: Path to WebSphere Application Server product code

variable.name: WORK_PATH
variable.label: WORK_PATH
variable.description: Path to contain the files used by zpmt.sh.

variable.name: WORKLOAD_DEPLOYMENT_GROUP
variable.label: WORKLOAD_DEPLOYMENT_GROUP
variable.description: The name of the workload deployment group in the z/OS Communication Server

variable.name: Z_CONFIG_HFS_VOLUME
variable.label: Z_CONFIG_HFS_VOLUME
variable.description: DASD volume where the config zfs will be created

variable.name: Z_CONFIG_HFS_PRIMARY
variable.label: Z_CONFIG_HFS_PRIMARY
variable.description: Initial number of cylinders used for the creation of the app server config file system

variable.name: Z_CONFIG_HFS_SECONDARY
variable.label: Z_CONFIG_HFS_SECONDARY
variable.description: Secondary amount of cylinders to be specified for the app server config file system

variable.name: Z_CONFIG_SPECIFY_SMS
variable.label: Z_CONFIG_SPECIFY_SMS
variable.description: Flag indicating whether SMS parameters need to be specified for the app server config file system

variable.name: Z_CONFIG_DATACLAS
variable.label: Z_CONFIG_DATACLAS
variable.description: App server config file system DATACLAS

variable.name: Z_CONFIG_MGMTCLAS
variable.label: Z_CONFIG_MGMTCLAS
variable.description: App server config file system MGMTCLAS

variable.name: Z_CONFIG_STORCLAS
variable.label: Z_CONFIG_STORCLAS
variable.description: App server config file system STORCLAS

variable.name: ZPMT_DATASET_HLQ
variable.label: ZPMT_DATASET_HLQ
variable.description: High level qualifier of datasets that will contain jobs and execs used in setting up the app server.

variable.name: DEFAULT_ADMIN_PW
variable.label: DEFAULT_ADMIN_PW
variable.description: Default admin ID password

variable.name: STARTING_GID
variable.label: STARTING_GID
variable.description: This is the first in a range of uids that will be referenced in the app server profile creation.

variable.name: STARTING_UID
variable.label: STARTING_UID
variable.description: This is the first in a range of uids that will be referenced in the app server profile creation.

variable.name: Z_CONFIG_AUTO_GID
variable.label: Z_CONFIG_AUTO_GID
variable.description: Flag indicating whether RACF should assign GIDs automatically.

variable.name: Z_CONFIG_AUTO_UID
variable.label: Z_CONFIG_AUTO_UID
variable.description: Flag indicating whether RACF should assign GIDs automatically.

variable.name: SOAP_CONNECTOR_ADDRESS_ID
variable.label: SOAP_CONNECTOR_ADDRESS_ID
variable.abstract: Soap port ID for the app server
variable.description: The ID of the allocated Soap port to use during deprovisioning

variable.name: UID0_USER
variable.label: UID0_USER
variable.description: UID0_USER - Specifies id to be associated with workflow steps that run zpmt.sh and the batch jobs it creates.

variable.name: CONSOLE_USER
variable.label: CONSOLE_USER
variable.description: CONSOLE_USER - Specifies user id to be associated with workflow steps that issue z/OS console commands.

variable.name: PWRESET_USER
variable.label: PWRESET_USER
variable.description: PWRESET_USER - Specifies user id to be associated with workflow step that resets the admin user id password.

variable.name: IP_USER
variable.label: IP_USER
variable.description: IP_USER - Specifies user id to be associated with workflow steps that request IP address and ports from z/OSMF Configuration Assistant.

variable.name: PROCLIB_USER
variable.label: PROCLIB_USER
variable.description: PROCLIB_USER - Specifies user id to be associated with workflow steps that update a dataset in the JES2 proclib concatenation.

variable.name: UID0_APPROVER
variable.label: UID0_APPROVER
variable.description: UID0_APPROVER - Specifies id to approve workflow steps that run zpmt.sh and the batch jobs it creates.

variable.name: CONSOLE_APPROVER
variable.label: CONSOLE_APPROVER
variable.description: CONSOLE_APPROVER - Specifies user id to approve workflow steps that issue z/OS console commands.

variable.name: PWRESET_APPROVER
variable.label: PWRESET_APPROVER
variable.description: PWRESET_APPROVER - Specifies user id to approve workflow step that resets the admin user id password.

variable.name: IP_APPROVER
variable.label: IP_APPROVER
variable.description: IP_APPROVER - Specifies user id to approve workflow steps that request IP address and ports from z/OSMF Configuration Assistant.

variable.name: PROCLIB_APPROVER
variable.label: PROCLIB_APPROVER
variable.description: PROCLIB_APPROVER - Specifies user id to approve workflow steps that update a dataset in the JES2 proclib concatenation.

variable.name: ADMIN_UID
variable.label: ADMIN_UID
variable.abstract: UID of the WAS admin user
variable.description: The value of this variable is calculated within the zpmt response file template based on the STARTING_UID and the SERVER_ID_NUM.

variable.name: CONFIG_GID
variable.label: CONFIG_GID
variable.description: The value of this variable is calculated within the zpmt response file template based on the STARTING_GID and the SERVER_ID_NUM.

variable.name: CONTROL_UID
variable.label: CONTROL_UID
variable.abstract: UID of the user id for the control region
variable.description: The value of this variable is calculated within the zpmt response file template based on the STARTING_UID and the SERVER_ID_NUM.

variable.name: LOCAL_USER_GID
variable.label: LOCAL_USER_GID
variable.abstract: GID of the local user group
variable.description: The value of this variable is calculated within the zpmt response file template based on the STARTING_GID and the SERVER_ID_NUM.

variable.name: SERVANT_GID
variable.label: SERVANT_GID
variable.abstract: GID of the servant user group
variable.description: The value of this variable is calculated within the zpmt response file template based on the STARTING_GID and the SERVER_ID_NUM.

variable.name: SERVANT_UID
variable.label: SERVANT_UID
variable.abstract: UID of the user id for the servant region
variable.description: The value of this variable is calculated within the zpmt response file template based on the STARTING_UID and the SERVER_ID_NUM.

variable.name: UNAUTH_UID
variable.label: UNAUTH_UID
variable.abstract: UID of the WAS unauthenticated user
variable.description: The value of this variable is calculated within the zpmt response file template based on the STARTING_UID and the SERVER_ID_NUM.

variable.name: RUNJOBS_KEY
variable.label: RUNJOBS_KEY
variable.description: Reserved for future use

variable.name: IP_ADDRESS
variable.label: IP_ADDRESS
variable.abstract: IP Address for the app server
variable.description: IP Address for the app server

variable.name: IP_ADDRESS_ID
variable.label: IP_ADDRESS_ID
variable.abstract: IP Address ID for the app server
variable.description: The ID of the allocated IP address to use during deprovisioning

step.name: promptForID
step.title: Provide Server ID Number
step.instructions: A three digit numeric id is required for each provisioned application server. This number is used to create various names and paths for the server. If you provide a number that has already been used, the provision process will fail. A pooling mechanism will be provided in the future to track which numbers have been used. Click FINISH to perform this step and provision the specified application server.

step.name: getSoapPort
step.title: Get Soap Port
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to obtain a port from z/OS Communications Server.

step.name: getAdminLocalPort
step.title: Get Admin Local Port
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to obtain a port from z/OS Communications Server.

step.name: getAdminConsolePort
step.title: Get Admin Console Port
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to obtain a port from z/OS Communications Server.

step.name: getAdminConsoleSecurePort
step.title: Get Admin Console Secure Port
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to obtain a port from z/OS Communications Server.

step.name: getAdminOverlayTCPPort
step.title: Get Admin Overlay TCP Port
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to obtain a port from z/OS Communications Server.

step.name: getAdminOverlayUDPPort
step.title: Get Admin Overlay UDP Port
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to obtain a port from z/OS Communications Server.

step.name: getDaemonPort
step.title: Get Daemon Port
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to obtain a port from z/OS Communications Server.

step.name: getDaemonSSLPort
step.title: Get Daemon SSL Port
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to obtain a port from z/OS Communications Server.

step.name: getHighAvailManagerPort
step.title: Get High Avail Manager Port
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to obtain a port from z/OS Communications Server.

step.name: getHTTPTransportPort
step.title: Get HTTP Transport Port
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to obtain a port from z/OS Communications Server.

step.name: getHTTPTransportSSLPort
step.title: Get HTTP Transport SSL Port
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to obtain a port from z/OS Communications Server.

step.name: getORBListenerPort
step.title: Get ORB Listener Port
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to obtain a port from z/OS Communications Server.

step.name: getORBListenerSSLPort
step.title: Get ORB Listener SSL Port
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to obtain a port from z/OS Communications Server.

step.name: getServiceIntegrationMQPort
step.title: Get Service Integration MQ Port
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to obtain a port from z/OS Communications Server.

step.name: getServiceIntegrationPort
step.title: Get Service Integration Port
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to obtain a port from z/OS Communications Server.

step.name: getServiceIntegrationSecurePort
step.title: Get Service Integration Secure Port
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to obtain a port from z/OS Communications Server.

step.name: getServiceIntegrationsecureMQPort
step.title: Get Service Integration secure MQ Port
step.description: Get Service Integration Secure MQ Port
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to obtain a port from z/OS Communications Server.

step.title: Get Session Initiation Port

step.name: getSessionInitiationSecurePort

step.name: getDynamicIPAddress
step.title: Get IP address
step.description: Get IP address for the new server
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to retrieve the IP address from z/OS Communications Server.

step.name: deleteZpmtWorkFiles
step.title: Delete zpmt.sh work files
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to delete zpmt.sh work files

step.name: deleteZpmtDatasets
step.title: deleteZpmtDatasets
step.instructions: This step automatically submits an IDCAMS batch job to delete datasets created by zpmt.sh

step.name: createResponse
step.title: Create the zpmt.sh response file
step.description: Use workflow template and velocity variable substitution to create response file
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to create the zpmt.sh response file from a template.

step.name: runZpmt
step.title: Run zpmt.sh to build the jobs to create the app server
step.description: Run zpmt.sh to build the jobs to create the app server
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to invoke zpmt.sh

step.name: removeJobcards
step.title: removeJobcards
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to remove job cards from the JCL created by zpmt.sh. This enables the JCL to be included in jobs submitted in the following workflow steps.

step.name: BBOWCFS
step.title: BBOWCFS
step.instructions:
This step runs automatically to submit a job to create the app server's config file system. The following instructions are for running the job manually:
User ID requirement:
File system update authority (see above), and the authority to allocate
OMVS.PRV.WITMAINT.WAS85.BBOBASE.BBONODE.HFS
Before running this job:
Verify that the DD statement which defines the data set is valid for the storage rules defined on the target system.
This job:
o Creates a mount point directory
/wasv85config/bbobase/bbonode
o Allocates the configuration file system
OMVS.PRV.WITMAINT.WAS85.BBOBASE.BBONODE.HFS
and mounts it at the above mount point.
Note: You can run job BBO855CA instead of BBOWCFS if the target WebSphere Application Server for z/OS installation image is at least at the 8.5.5.0 service level. The BBO855CA job will use the directory specified by the TMPDIR environment variable, if defined, for temporary files. The user ID requirements fo
DO NOT RUN THIS JOB IF:
1. The configuration file system already exists and is mounted at the desired mountpoint, or if
2. The mount point directory is controlled by automount. Either disable the automount rule for the configuration mount point while running this job, or perform the following steps manually:
a. Allocate the configuration file system data set.
b. Issue the following shell commands, which will also cause automount to mount the file system
chmod 775 /wasv85config/bbobase/bbonode
chown WSADMIN:WSCFG1 /wasv85config/bbobase/bbonode
BEFORE YOU BEGIN: The BBOWCFS job assumes your root file system is mounted in read/write mode. If the root file system is not mounted in read/write mode, manually create the directory
/wasv85config/bbobase/bbonode
and any needed higher directories, set file permissions to 775, and set the owning user ID and group to WSADMIN and WSCFG1 before running BBOWCFS.
EXAMPLE: If you plan to use /wasv8config as your directory, issue the following commands from within the OMVS shell:
mkdir -p -m 775 /wasv8config
chown -R WSADMIN:WSCFG1 /wasv8config

step.name: saveInfoForDeprovisioning
step.title: Save deprovisioning information for the new server.
step.description: Save the IP address id for future deprovisioning
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to create a file in the app server config directory containing information that will be required for deprovisioning.

template.inlineTemplate: echo IP_ADDRESS_ID ${instance-IP_ADDRESS_ID} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.deprovision echo SOAP_CONNECTOR_ADDRESS_ID ${instance-SOAP_CONNECTOR_ADDRESS_ID} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.deprovision echo IPC_CONNECTOR_ADDRESS_ID ${instance-IPC_CONNECTOR_ADDRESS_ID} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.deprovision echo WC_adminhost_ID ${instance-WC_adminhost_ID} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.deprovision echo WC_adminhost_secure_ID ${instance-WC_adminhost_secure_ID} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.deprovision echo OVERLAY_TCP_LISTENER_ADDRESS_ID ${instance-OVERLAY_TCP_LISTENER_ADDRESS_ID} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.deprovision echo OVERLAY_UDP_LISTENER_ADDRESS_ID ${instance-OVERLAY_UDP_LISTENER_ADDRESS_ID} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.deprovision echo DAEMON_PORT_ID ${instance-DAEMON_PORT_ID} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.deprovision echo DAEMON_SSL_PORT_ID ${instance-DAEMON_SSL_PORT_ID} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.deprovision echo DCS_UNICAST_ADDRESS_ID ${instance-DCS_UNICAST_ADDRESS_ID} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.deprovision echo WC_defaulthost_ID ${instance-WC_defaulthost_ID} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.deprovision echo WC_defaulthost_secure_ID ${instance-WC_defaulthost_secure_ID} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.deprovision echo BOOTSTRAP_ADDRESS_ID ${instance-BOOTSTRAP_ADDRESS_ID} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.deprovision echo ORB_SSL_LISTENER_ADDRESS_ID ${instance-ORB_SSL_LISTENER_ADDRESS_ID} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.deprovision echo SIB_MQ_ENDPOINT_ADDRESS_ID ${instance-SIB_MQ_ENDPOINT_ADDRESS_ID} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.deprovision echo SIB_ENDPOINT_ADDRESS_ID ${instance-SIB_ENDPOINT_ADDRESS_ID} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.deprovision echo SIB_MQ_ENDPOINT_SECURE_ADDRESS_ID ${instance-SIB_MQ_ENDPOINT_SECURE_ADDRESS_ID} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.deprovision echo SIB_ENDPOINT_SECURE_ADDRESS_ID ${instance-SIB_ENDPOINT_SECURE_ADDRESS_ID} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.deprovision echo SIP_DEFAULTHOST_ID ${instance-SIP_DEFAULTHOST_ID} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.deprovision echo SIP_DEFAULTHOST_SECURE_ID ${instance-SIP_DEFAULTHOST_SECURE_ID} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.deprovision

step.name: saveNetworkingInfo
step.title: Save IP address and port numbers in a file.
step.description: Save IP address and port numbers in a file
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to create a file in the app server config directory containing the virtual IP address and port numbers.

template.inlineTemplate: echo IP_ADDRESS ${instance-IP_ADDRESS} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.ports echo SOAP_CONNECTOR_ADDRESS ${instance-SOAP_CONNECTOR_ADDRESS} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.ports echo IPC_CONNECTOR_ADDRESS ${instance-IPC_CONNECTOR_ADDRESS} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.ports echo WC_adminhost ${instance-WC_adminhost} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.ports echo WC_adminhost_secure ${instance-WC_adminhost_secure} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.ports echo OVERLAY_TCP_LISTENER_ADDRESS ${instance-OVERLAY_TCP_LISTENER_ADDRESS} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.ports echo OVERLAY_UDP_LISTENER_ADDRESS ${instance-OVERLAY_UDP_LISTENER_ADDRESS} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.ports echo DAEMON_PORT ${instance-DAEMON_PORT} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.ports echo DAEMON_SSL_PORT ${instance-DAEMON_SSL_PORT} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.ports echo DCS_UNICAST_ADDRESS ${instance-DCS_UNICAST_ADDRESS} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.ports echo WC_defaulthost ${instance-WC_defaulthost} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.ports echo WC_defaulthost_secure ${instance-WC_defaulthost_secure} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.ports echo BOOTSTRAP_ADDRESS ${instance-BOOTSTRAP_ADDRESS} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.ports echo ORB_SSL_LISTENER_ADDRESS ${instance-ORB_SSL_LISTENER_ADDRESS} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.ports echo SIB_MQ_ENDPOINT_ADDRESS ${instance-SIB_MQ_ENDPOINT_ADDRESS} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.ports echo SIB_ENDPOINT_ADDRESS ${instance-SIB_ENDPOINT_ADDRESS} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.ports echo SIB_MQ_ENDPOINT_SECURE_ADDRESS ${instance-SIB_MQ_ENDPOINT_SECURE_ADDRESS} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.ports echo SIB_ENDPOINT_SECURE_ADDRESS ${instance-SIB_ENDPOINT_SECURE_ADDRESS} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.ports echo SIP_DEFAULTHOST ${instance-SIP_DEFAULTHOST} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.ports echo SIP_DEFAULTHOST_SECURE ${instance-SIP_DEFAULTHOST_SECURE} >> $instance-CONFIG_ROOT/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}.ports

step.name: BBOSBRAM
step.title: BBOSBRAM
step.instructions:
This step runs automatically to create home directories for the app server user ids. The following instructions are for running this job manually:
User ID requirement:
File system update authority (see Verify File Systems step).
This job creates home directories for WebSphere for z/OS user IDS. These home directories will be subdirectories of /var/WebSphere/home
This job will:
Create the following directory with permission bits 755:
/var/WebSphere/home
Create the following directory with ownership WSCRU1:WSCFG1 and permission bits 770:
/var/WebSphere/home/WSCFG1
Create the following directory with ownership WSCRU1:WSSR1 and permission bits 770:
/var/WebSphere/home/WSSR1
Create the following directory with ownership WSCRU1:WSCLGP and permission bits 770:
/var/WebSphere/home/WSCLGP
This job should be run on each z/OS system that will host WebSphere Application Server nodes using these WebSphere for z/OS common groups and owner user ID. After execution, verify that the directories have been created with the correct permissions on each system.
If these directories already exist with the specified ownership and permission on a target system, then this job does not need to be run on that system.
ATTENTION: If the directory
/var/WebSphere/home
is used by applications other than WebSphere Application Server, make sure that the permissions set by BBOSBRAM (755) are appropriate, or change them manually. This directory must be world-readable for Websphere Application Server to run correctly.

step.name: BBOWHFSA
step.title: BBOWHFSA
step.instructions:
This step runs automatically to create directories and populate directories in preparation for the app server profile creation. The following instructions are for running the job manually:
User ID requirement:
File system update authority (see above).
This job populates the previously-created configuration file system and prepares it for profile creation.
Note: You can run job BBO855HA instead of BBOWHFSA if the target WebSphere Application Server for z/OS installation image is at least at the 8.5.5.0 service level. The BBO855HA job will use the directory specified by the TMPDIR environment variable, if defined, for temporary files. The user ID requirements f
Note: If the SCEERUN data set is not in the system link list, add that data set to STEPLIB for the CHECKV step in BBOWHFSA.
Upon completion, examine the job output. Success is indicated with a RC=0 in the job output.

step.name: BBOWWPFA
step.title: BBOWWPFA
step.instructions:
This step runs automatically to create the app server profile. The following instructions are for running the profile creation job manually:
User ID requirement:
File system update authority (see Verify File System step).
This job creates a profile (set of configuration files for a node) in the configuration file system.
Note: You can run job BBO855PA instead of BBOWWPFA if the target WebSphere Application Server for z/OS installation image is at least at the 8.5.5.0 service level. The BBO855PA job will use the directory specified by the TMPDIR environment variable, if defined, for temporary files. The user ID requirements for t
Note: If the SCEERUN2 data set is not in the system link list, add that data set to STEPLIB for the LIBVSCRP and WPROFILE steps in BBOWWPFA.
Upon completion, examine the job output. Success is indicated by rc=0.
Note: If the BBOWWPFA (profile creation job) fails, you must perform the following steps to remove the partially built profile:
cd /wasv85config/bbobase/bbonode/AppServer
./bin/manageprofiles.sh -deleteAll
rm -R profiles
Then, correct the problem that caused BBOWWPFA to failand re-run the job

step.name: BBOWPROC
step.title: BBOWPROC
step.instructions:
This step runs automatically to create procs for the app server. The following instructions are for running the job manually:
User ID requirement:
Authority to update the cataloged procedure library
This job creates the tailored cataloged procedures and copies them to your procedure library.
Note: You can run job BBO855RA instead of BBOWPROC if the target WebSphere Application Server for z/OS installation image is at least at the 8.5.5.0 service level. The BBO855RA job will use the directory specified by the TMPDIR environment variable, if defined, for temporary files. The user ID requirements for th
ATTENTION: Be aware that you may overlay existing members in the above data set.

step.name: resetAdminPW
step.title: resetAdminPW
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to reset the password of the WAS admin user id.

template.inlineTemplate: /* Rexx */ trace commands address tso "alu ${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}AD${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM} password(${instance-DEFAULT_ADMIN_PW}) resume" exit

step.name: disableSharedClassCache
step.title: Disable shared class cache
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to disable shared class cache

template.inlineTemplate: cd ${instance-CONFIG_ROOT}/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/AppServer/profiles/default/config/cells/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/nodes/${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}/servers/server1 pwd sed -e 's/-Xshareclasses/#-Xshareclasses/g' control.jvm.options > control.jvm.options.new chown ${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}AD${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}:${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}CF${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM} control.jvm.options.new mv control.jvm.options control.jvm.options.unmodified mv control.jvm.options.new control.jvm.options echo "***** Modified control region JVM options *****" cat control.jvm.options echo sed -e 's/-Xshareclasses/#-Xshareclasses/g' servant.jvm.options > servant.jvm.options.new chown ${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}AD${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM}:${instance-SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX}CF${instance-SERVER_ID_NUM} servant.jvm.options.new mv servant.jvm.options servant.jvm.options.unmodified mv servant.jvm.options.new servant.jvm.options echo "***** Modified servant region JVM options *****" cat servant.jvm.options

step.name: startServer
step.title: Start the app server
step.instructions: This step starts the app server
